model

Class MiniMaxEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.MiniMaxEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameEngine

    public class MiniMaxEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements GameEngine
    this class generates moves by using an implementation of the minimax algorithm. Unfortunately this implementation is broken and currently useless.
    Author:
    {}rpheus

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private static int evaluationFunctionCPU(Board board, java.lang.String token)
      this method evaluates a board-state based on whether a 3-length has been achieved, how many 2-lengths have been occupied and the number of 3-length that have not been blocked off.
      private int evaluationFunctionHuman(Board board, java.lang.String token)
      the same function as above called with the opposite token,together these two methods make up the full evaluation function.

      • generateMove

        public Move generateMove(Board board,
                java.lang.String token)
        this method generates a 'Move' object based on the current state of the board and the token of the player requesting the move.
        Specified by:
        generateMove in interface GameEngine
        Parameters:
        board - the current state of the board
        token - the token for the player requesting the move
        Returns:
        Move (a 'Move' object)

      • miniMax

        private Move miniMax(int depth,
           java.lang.String token)
        implementation of the miniMax algorithm takes a lookahead value(depth) and a player token. this generates a move that is then passed to generateMove().

        the minimax algorithm is an algorithm that evaluates all available moves of a particular board-state by recursing over all available moves and scoring them based on who's turn it is, chosing the minimum score when the AI is playing and the maximum score when the human is playing.
        Parameters:
        depth - the number of moves to look ahead
        token - the token of the player requesting the move
        Returns:
        Move the generated move.

      • evaluationFunctionCPU

        private static int evaluationFunctionCPU(Board board,
                        java.lang.String token)
        this method evaluates a board-state based on whether a 3-length has been achieved, how many 2-lengths have been occupied and the number of 3-length that have not been blocked off. This method and the human version make up the full evaluation function.
        Parameters:
        board - board-state to be analysed
        token - the token of the player who's move is being evaluated
        Returns:
        int representation of the score

      • evaluationFunctionHuman

        private int evaluationFunctionHuman(Board board,
                          java.lang.String token)
        the same function as above called with the opposite token,together these two methods make up the full evaluation function.
        Parameters:
        board - board-state to be evaluated
        token - the token of the opposing player
        Returns:
        int representation of score
